page.title: 06Planning W. Grove
page.content: A District Councillor from W. Grove says he does not want any more houses erected after those being built in 1985 are completed, as existing amenities in Grove will not support further growth. A new complex of 28 flats for the elderly, being built by the Vale of White Horse District Council are almost complete. A Shopping Centre and possibly a church is planned, but the site originally reserved for a school, now has houses built on it, since the birthrate has declined. Alongside the BNF and Metal Box factories may be put some starter unit factories. The District Council is currently battling with the County Council for road improvement in W. Grove. An appeal by the Council to have moved the Early Warning Siren, which is unsightly, may be successful.
